result.execSummary:
Darian Quashon McClain was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Darian Quashon McClain was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darian Quashon McClain

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Case called at 9:40AM
Defendant Darian Quashon McClain in court, in custody and without counsel. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant advises that he wishes to waive extradition in this file.
The Court recites right to counsel. The Defendant advises that he wishes to proceed without an attorney. The Court finds that the Defendant is competent to represent himself.
Extradition rights are reviewed. The Defendant verifies that he understands these rights.
Att Jeffrey De La Rosa appears in the courtroom at 9:43AM indicating that he is now representing the Defendant. Att De La Rosa advises the Court that the Defendant wishes to proceed with an extradition waiver, and that he will counsel his client and sign the forms.
The Court goes off the record.

recess 9:43AM

----------------------------

reconvene 9:48AM

The Defendant verifies that he continues to want to waive extradition, and that he signed the waiver forms during the recess.
The Court notarizes the four original versions of the waiver of extradition and hearing forms that the Defendant signed. The Court affirms that the copies will be disbursed as required.

recess 9:50AM

[Post Hearing - Clerk's note: Original versions of the Waiver of Extradition and Hearing form are provided to JESO c/o Dep Mann and to the Defendant.
Request for Detective to Appear via Telephone
Extradition hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:20 PM 
Defendant Darian Quashon McClain appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.

The Court reviews with Mr. McClain his right to challenge extradition.

Atty De La Rosa indicates that Mr. McClain is contesting extradition

The Court finds that Darian Quashon McClain is the person appearing via video conferencing today, and is captioned in extradition paperwork. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court does not admit Mr. McClain to bond. [statute 976.03(16) cited]
recess 2:30  pm. 

NEXT: Extradition Hearing on 8/18/22 at 9:45am
